page.title: 10ETTON-1
page.content: {ETTON IN 1985 There are only three working farms in the village-the farm houses having been sold and converted into'desirable residences'for professional & business people who commute to Beverley and Hull.Many of the labourers' cottages are now also similarly converted.The church still functions,though now under a'Vicar in Charge'who has many extra parochial duties.The Methodist chapel was demolished to make way for a garage for the modernised 'Chapel Cottage'next door.Many of the smart houses have similar sounding names- Wold View,Beech Cottage-to go well with the hanging baskets,street lamps and tubs of flowers.The school,Post Office and shop have closed.The children and pensioners now travel to Cherry Burton.The blacksmith has not returned,though his business(CONT>
